title: League is more of a "kids game" than fortnite
body: This game's skill ceiling keeps going down because of Riot making changes that cater to casuals, i dont get it why encourage your players to stay n00b. They buff easy champs while nerf high skill champs and also like the change to riven which made it easier to animation cancel. Also the way solo queue works like how a toddler can win a game just by being lucky. While fortnite even tho its cartoony it is a high skill game, it rewards skill but league rewards luck more than skill. Say you put 1000 hours into league what now? You get better at the game but still wouldnt be able to do anything if you dont get lucky, thats how this game is reliant on your team (luck = better team). While if you put that many hours you will be extremely good at the game and probably gonna be at popular fortnite streamers level.

replies.body:
I'm curious if Fortnite issues punishments as much for chat. Is this becoming the new normal for competitive gaming?

Also, theoretically, balance means that every champ is equally viable for its niche. Easy or hard doesn't matter. Ideally, anyone can play whatever champ they enjoy to any level. In practice, I agree that you might feel someone playing Garen shouldn't win as much as you spending hundreds of hours on Riven.

It becomes a requirement as soon as a game gets a large community, if they want to keep any adult players.

Games aimed squarely at teenage males typically dont care.

Its all about the money, LCS pros and streamers don't even enjoy the game they play for money and cant even speak abuut it or they can get in trouble but they sometimes give hints that alot of things are plain stupid and should not exist in any game that calls itself competetive.

Sadly RIOT needs to keep the casual bronze players (the ones that spend the most money) interested and not feel like they need to study,practice or dedicate to anything to be able to 1 shot or outplay somebody even when they are years lacking in game knowledge. 

If Riot ever buffs high skill champions the community goes wild especialy those who use point and click champions. Riot should realy focus on high skill champions more and punish those who play easy point and clicks, but its all the contrary.
